WorkItem.ClosedComment: Please reopen if you have this issue re-occur and can tell us what Addons were loaded at that time.
WorkItem.Description:
Importing upgrade list failed. The import window will only accept 12 characters!
The error is "Rawr: Invalid Rawr data entered please check you have copied data" etc
I'm using rawr 4.2.4, and the addon is v0.68 (rUnknown)
I've attached the xml, but that's not the problem. The restricted import window is the problem.
Cheers,
Toby
WorkItem.Summary: [Addon] import failed due to restricted import window

Comments.Message: Are you using the WPF (download) version or the Silverlight (EJ web) version?

Download WPF.
But it's the wow addon that has the problem.

Ahh... I didn't realize this was an addon issue.  
Did you actually Copy & Paste into that window despite that it only shows 12 characters?  I think the buffer is larger than that, just isn't displayed.  Kinda like the export frame.

Yup. Copy & paste into wow didn't work, whereas pasting into notepad showed I had the whole thing in the clipboard.
I tried to type more than 12 chrs, that didn't work either.
However.... I tried again today, and it worked fine.
So, I guess the issue gets shelved <shrug>
(I have seen this several times in the past though)

No-one to date has been able to tell us a 100% reproducible way for this to fail.

The restriction to 12 chars is new info however, it MAY be that some other addon is using the same variables or something for the edit box and the addon code has a bug that leaks this variable. I could check that if I knew what other addons were in use.
lol, I have dozens of addons! Next time this problem strikes I shall reload UI with just rawr to see if it's an addon clash.
